header.subtext: How frequency difference drives power flow without communication
header.tagline: Physics does the balancing — no central controller

scenario_section.title: SCENARIO: House 2 plugs in EV charger (7kW)
scenario_section.visual: 4 houses in a row connected by AC bus

before_state.label: BEFORE — All balanced
before_state.bus: 50.0 Hz — No power flowing between houses

physics_diagram.title: THE PHYSICS — Frequency = Load Indicator
physics_diagram.visual: large central diagram showing frequency vs power relationship

elements.description: Downward sloping line from 50.0Hz at 0kW to 48.5Hz at 6kW
elements.label: DROOP CURVE — same for all inverters

elements.content:
LOWER frequency = MORE loaded = RECEIVES power
HIGHER frequency = LESS loaded = SENDS power

flow_visualization.title: POWER FLOWS LIKE A BICYCLE CHAIN
flow_visualization.visual: artistic representation of power as bicycle chain connecting houses
flow_visualization.description: AC bus shown as a glowing bicycle chain loop connecting all houses. Houses with surplus pedal faster (higher frequency), houses with load feel resistance (lower frequency). Chain tension transfers energy automatically.
flow_visualization.metaphor: Pedaling faster = higher frequency = you're helping others. Climbing a hill = lower frequency = others help you through the chain.

outcomes.text: H2 gets 9kW total (6kW local + 3kW from neighbors)
Works even if one inverter fails

key_insight.text: Every inverter follows the SAME droop curve. The math guarantees equal sharing.
key_insight.formula: If all k = 0.25 Hz/kW, load splits equally regardless of where it connects
